item.title: Diablo 3 Real Money AH
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
There is a lot of reason I’m not happy with Diablo 3 and how it seems to be coming along. I guess it all boils down to it not being the game I was expecting and hoping for. The art style is the obvious starting point. When I say the art style, people automatically assume that I mean that it’s not dark enough. That’s not it though. It’s the style of the game that’s bothering me. Not only does it not look very attractive ( it looks dated, and it’s not even released yet ), but it deviates wildly from what was established in the previous 2 games. It takes a dark and moody style and replaces it with an exaggerated cartoonish style, odd proportions, and an over the top design. A lot of people say that it worked okay for TF2, so why not Diablo3, but that isn’t comparable because anyone who actually played team fortress in the old days would have noticed an obvious dark comedy to the violence. I’m not for or against investing so heavily in this, but at least with TF2 I can see why. It’s been said that the art style was chosen because it would be easier to distinguish characters and objects. I don’t think that is true at all, because it is a fairly simple task of making an art style similar to the original work.

This new announcement of the transactions, I can see the reasoning for, but I don’t support accepting a problem, and simply integrating it as part of the game. Fixing or finding a way of balancing or a way to make the game work in spite of what people may do. In truth though it’s not a big deal in my mind. It might impact others more though.

I am VERY disappointed to hear that the levelling system where you customize your character build is removed. Planning a character was something I enjoyed.

I do like the female and Male variants of characters, but I’m not liking a lot of the way the combat looks right now. It seems to lack that certain something that made the combat satisfying. Then again, maybe that’s just because it doesn’t translate to video very well. I just notice that the person playing seems to be a bit unskilled with the 'ol mouse movement. So it’s either not as crisply controlled or they have a fellow playing the game with motor control issues playing the game during the videos ( very possible, lots of times people selected to play game demonstrations are inept ).

Anyhoo, just my thoughts. I’m just glad that there looks to be alternatives that are more directed at the type of game I wanted. I’m sure on reputation alone Diablo 3 will do well. It just doesn’t seem like the game for me though.
